paper_title.en: Nuclear resonant inelastic and forward scattering of synchrotron radiation by K-40

description.en: We achieved excitation of the first excited state of K-40 and confirmed both energy and lifetime. Furthermore, we observed nuclear resonant inelastic scattering by K-40 in a powdered KCl sample at room temperature using a high-resolution monochromator. The time spectrum of the nuclear resonant forward scattering was measured at K-50. Our observations of nuclear resonant inelastic and forward scattering by K-40 make electronic and dynamic studies for potassium practical. The measurements of nuclear resonant scattering for the radioactive K-40 nuclide will enable and lead to further studies of other radioactive nuclides.

paper_title.en: Dynamics of Fe Cations in an H<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub> Solution by Nuclear Resonance Quasielastic Scattering
I-129 and Au-197 M(]E88D8[)ssbauer Spectroscopy of AuI and AgAuI<sub>2</sub>
Charge transfer phase transition and ferromagnetism in a mixed-valence iron complex, (n-C3H7)4N[FeIIFe III(dto)3] (dto = C2O2S2)

description.en: We have investigated the physical properties of (n-C3H7)4N[FeIIFe III(dto)3] (dto = C2O2S2) by means of 57Fe Mössbauer spectroscopy and magnetic susceptibility measurement. From the analysis of 57Fe Mössbauer spectra and magnetic susceptibility, we have discovered a new type of first order phase transition around 120 K, where the charge transfer transition between FeII and FeIII occurs reversibly. In the higher temperature phase, the FeIII (S = 1/2) and FeII (S = 2) sites are coordinated by six S atoms and six O atoms, respectively. In the lower temperature phase, on the other hand, the FeIII (S = 5/2) and FeII (S = 0) sites are coordinated by six O atoms and six S atoms, respectively. Moreover, we have found the ferromagnetic phase transition at 6.5 K. The ferromagnetic order is presumably induced by the charge transfer interaction between the FeIII (S = 5/2) and FeII (S = 0) sites. © 2001 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Nuclear resonant quasielastic scattering from Fe cations in Nafion membranes: Effect of dynamics in a short time range

description.en: The effect of the diffusive motion in a short time range on the nuclear resonant quasielastic scattering spectrum is presented. The solution of the Langevin equation, which describes the motion of the diffusing particle in a short time range as well as that in a long time range, was applied to analyze the nuclear resonant scattering spectrum of Fe cations in Nafion membranes instead of the solution of the generally-used simple diffusion equation which does not describe the diffusive motion in a short time range correctly. It made improvements in the fitting especially at the wings of the data as compared with the solution of the simple diffusion equation. The characteristic time of the diffusive motion of Fe ions in Nafion is estimated to he about 10(-14) s. By the detailed analysis of the high energy part of nuclear resonant scattering spectrum, it is possible to reveal diffusive motion even in the short time range as similar to 10(-14) s.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
Transactions of the Materials Research Society of Japan

paper_title.en: Dynamics of Fe cations in Nafion membranes studied by nuclear resonant quasielastic scattering of synchrotron radiation

description.en: Nuclear resonant quasielastic scattering from ferrous cations in ion-exchange Nafion membranes was measured at room temperature, and the intrinsic dynamics of the cations inside the spherical regions surrounded by the sulfonic groups of Nafion was studied. For the analysis, the formula of nuclear resonant absorption for a particle diffusing in a sphere with an impermeable surface was derived. The formula indicates that the effect of the surface upon the diffusive motion is small if the radius of the sphere is larger than a critical value; in the case of Fe-57 ions, the value is about 2 Angstrom. As the radius of the spherical regions in our Nafion samples is estimated to be about 5 Angstrom, the existence of the surface can be ignored and the intrinsic dynamics of Fe cations can be extracted. The diffusion coefficient estimated from the least squares fit was (1.12 +/- 0.13)x10(-5) cm(2)/s for 15 wt% water content. This value is in good agreement with that of Fe cations in an HCL solution. As a result, Fe cations in Nafion diffuse as freely as those in solutions.

paper_title.en: Nuclear Resonance Scattering of Synchrotron Radiation by <sup>40</sup>K
I-129 Mossbauer spectroscopic study in a MMX-chain system, M-2(dta)(4)I (M = Ni, Pt, dta = CH3CS2-)

description.en: The titlePt compound is a highly-conductive mixed-valence MMX-chain system. It exhibits a metal-semiconductor transition at 300 K, which is attributed to a valence transition of Pt from an average-valence state of +2.5 to a trapped-valence state of +2 and +3. From I-129 Mossbauer spectroscopic study, the 1-D structural mode was strongly suggested to be a -Pt-II -Pt-III-I-Pt-III-Pt-II -I-Pt-II-Pt-III-I-Pt-III-Pt-II- charge ordering state at 16 K. The charge-ordering mixed-valence state is discussed, as well as the valence state of the Ni compound, which is considered to be an averaged-valence Mott insulator.

Mossbauer study of iodine-doped fluoro-aluminum phthalocyanine

description.en: I-129-Mossbauer spectroscopy was applied to the iodine-doped fluoro-aluminum phthalocyanine in an antiferromagnetic phase. The iodine in this phase is proved to be only in the form of triiodide ion (I-3(-)).

paper_title.ja: 研究用原子炉の現状と將来
paper_title.en: Present Status and Future Prospect of Research Reactors.

description.ja: 我が国初の研究炉であるJRR-1が臨界に達したのは昭和32年のことであり,以来,研究炉は数こそ少ないが我が国における原子力の研究・開発を支える重要な役割を担ってきた。それとともに,中性子の基本的特性を利用する多種・多様な研究を可能として,自然科学のほぼ全分野にわたる領域の研究の推進に少なからず寄与してきたところである。本特集では,研究炉の現状および利用動向並びに新型研究炉の検討などについて紹介し,21世紀に向かってますます必要性の高まる「制御された中性子」とその高度利用の方法について総合的な観点から展望する。
